intro: Diplycosia lancifolia var. calvescens, commonly known as the narrow-leaved diplycosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of mostly flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
